comment: She literally was my worst teacher this semester, I dreaded her class so bad, (I left a couple times in tears), like she is so rude when you don't understand a concept. I initially took her class because her pass rate looked ok, but DON'T DO IT, (especially if you have ADHD) she zooms through lectures. I can go on and on about how much I prayed...

Slight accent (unnoticeable). No final exam. Lots of emphasis on group work. Online quizzes taken in class and "super quizzes" taken at home. Structure of the class made it the most difficult compared to the material itself. Knowing what to study to prepare for quizzes and super quizzes is unclear. Would not take again, even with no final exam.

she very much knows what shes talking about and explains it, but tends to over explain for a lot of it which can make it be confused for an introduction to biology. shes very nice, is easy to reach, etc, but its definitely a hard class! if you need biology just for a science credit, i would not take it, but as a bio major this class somewhat helped

BIOL 1107L 
She is kind, and the lab was easy. She has an accent, but as a non-native speaker, I had no trouble understanding her. Each week, there was a worksheet based on the lab, two quizzes, and a final poster presentation. However, it might be hard if you and your partner don't get along.
Bio 1107 L, very easy
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She has a thick accent and can be hard to understand. Her group work was confusing and she did not respond to my emails at all. The class itself can be difficult as she moves pretty fast and the topics can be confusing. She does zoom lectures and you can take the tests/quizzes from home. You could probably find a better professor.

Overall a nice lady, but the way she explained topics was often very confusing. Alternating quizzes and superquizzes every week with Pearson homework assignments and group work in between. I felt unprepared for the difficulty of quizzes and super quizzes even with studying. I relied heavily on the textbook and often felt like I was teaching myself.
I took her lab class, and she is very nice and caring. She always answers questions and helps if you feel stuck.

Quiz every week and superquiz every other week. She has zoom meetings and in-person and posts recordings. She asks questions in the lecture and can be VERY determined to get an answer. HW and textbook in Pearson. Group projects are PPT assignments, some Pearson, & a final video assignment. Utilize Pearson's study area + office hrs & u will be good

For the online lab there's a weekly lab that consists of 2-7 parts. There are 2 posters completed with a group throughout the semester which have very little instruction on what she wants and the rubric is unclear and vague and she does not respond to emails often. Overall, she's good as a last resort professor however if you can find someone else.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Overall, the class was okay. She just moves too fast on the lectures and sometimes does not remind us we have homework. The good thing is that the test are on lockdown with no camera so you can use notes. Also, you get 2 attempts but you have to do it within the time frame she assigns. You should pass though.

Overall, she is a really sweet lady, she genuinely cares about you and your grade. Be prepared to work with your group and communicate with them. She records lectures so if you miss one you can do zoom or just watch the recording. I would recommend her as she is overall caring and knows what she is talking about.
She was very kind, but the lectures would get off topic very often and we would all get lost. lots of tests that were not simmular to the in class work or textbook.

Professor tends to get off topic in her lectures and rushes through the information. Expects you to study the textbook before and after her classes. Also assigns lots of homework and group work and quizzes after every lecture. Would avoid if possible

Had alternating quiz & superquizzes every Tues. She was sweet but I taught myself a lot of the material. She was willing to help though. Gave a lot of extra credit and did ask class how they felt about material. If you have another option, take it, but she isnt that bad, you just have to be patient.

The quiz system makes most of the classwork pretty easy, but the group work and textbook homework can be pretty tough. The lectures are in-depth, but often too much so and don't always focus on quiz content. Professor Bhattarai is very accessible outside of class and values student opinion, however.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This teacher is either a hit or a miss for some people, and that is determined by how you choose to participate. If you are active in participation she will work with you (be on her good side).A good deal of homework. Quizzes are every week, and there are mandatory group projects. Tough grader but extra credit opportunities, lecture-heavy

The lab itself was easy, but whenever I asked for help about something I found confusing, she explained it in an even more confusing way and would look at me when she finished as if I should understand what she means. She has an accent that's easy to understand, but she talks like her mouth can't keep up with her thoughts.

She is nice enough and definitely knows what she is talking about, but her accent and tangent like pre-lab lectures made it feel like a middle school science camp. I almost fell asleep so many times while she was talking. She answers emails though and will not let you fail. Class was boring but it was easy and she was a decent choice.

She's fine, but she does have an accent so be wary of that. Kind of vague in instruction but still she taught well. I felt mildly unprepared for the lab final but I ended up doing fine in it. She gives good feedback but sometimes can make you feel a little stupid. Also show up to class on time.

If you were to take this class, make sure to be ready to do some heavy studying and have classmates to lean heavily on because you may never understand what she is ever saying. Then when you want to ask her certain questions, she may make you feel like you are not smart. Would reprimand students for being late, even if their broke down and was rude

terrible lab she always seemed confused in lab, she would say procedure that conflicted with the lab sheats that she gave for each lab which led to confusion and due dates and group projects where not very clear which led to even more confusion. overall I think she could have done a lot better bio 1 lab isnt hard but she made it confusing
